author: mini_mads1980
title: Just add a Fish
review:
Overview

At £3.99 in the UK, Issue 34 of the Lego City Comic gives us Jack Ocean, the 4th diver to appear.  The previous ones were in issues 3, 16 and 29.  Not only do you get the diver, but you also get a small plant section with a 1x2 gold tile.  The comic was on sale between 9th December 2020 and 5th January 2021.

Packet

The large foil packet shows the Minifigure well as he searches for the gold on the sea bed.  To me it appears that his torch wouldn't be shining on the gold as Jack seems too large compared to the plant life, implying it is behind him, however it shows what's in the set and Jack is the main element, so this is ok.

You can see that it contains 13 parts thanks to the yellow box in the top-right corner, 9 of which are Jack and his torch.  It is also aimed at 5+, which as ever seems a little high for how simple this is to build.

Minifigure

Unlike the previous diver in Issue 29, this one compliments the 2020 City line perfectly.  He is wearing the same suit and helmet as other 2020 sets, but his head element does not appear in any of the five Deep Sea Explorers sets or the Polybag 30370.  The head element has been used in lots of City sets before, so not unique, but it's good that this is a unique Minifigure.

The following parts are used for Jack:

  • Helmet - Multicombination (mostly Bright Red) Mini Helmet No 293 [6295962]
  • Head - Bright Yellow Mini Head No 1662 [6112620]
  • Air Tank - White Mini Oxygen Bottles [6268849]
  • Torso - Earth Blue Mini Upper Part No 5178 [6308426] (printed on both sides)
  • Legs - Earth Blue (with Bright Red) Mini Lower Part No 1906 [6307439]
  • Flippers - Bright Red Frogmans Foot [6172939]

Main Build/Parts 

This set is all about the Minifigure, so the sub-build here is only 4 parts.  The Earth Blue 3x3 seems a strange sea bed colour, but the plant element in Bright Bluish Green is very nice to have, keeping the same colour as the other City sets in the theme.  It would have been good to have had the gold bar hidden so Jack had to find it, and the inclusion of a fish would have been appreciated.  In similar diving sets we have had either a shark or a crab, making this the first without any water based animals.

Verdict

I like that this fits with the 2020 City Sets, but think it needs a little bit more.  As it is the current diver that Lego adds to sets, that is a positive, but the lack of fish stops it scoring more.

A small Police helicopter is in the next issue.
